title: Set $$f(x)=0$$
text: To find the x-intercept, let $$f(x)=0$$ and and solve for x.

title: Solve For The Parabola
text: Given $$a x^2+bx+c=0$$. We can use quadratic formula to get $$x=\frac{\left(-b\pm\sqrt{b^2-4ac}\right)}{2} a$$. In the given parabola, $$a=-1$$, $$b=-6$$ and $$c=-9$$.

title: Solve For The Parabola
text: Through apply the quadratic formula, we get the solution for $$f(x)=-\left(x^2\right)-6x-9=0$$ is $$x=-3$$

title: Put The Answer Into (x,y)
text: We know that $$y=0$$ in x-intercepts and we get $$x=-3$$ through the calculations above. Put together, we get one x-intercept (-3,0).
